resources.string: "While pinging, the packets that are lost will be displayed and counted."
"Specify the number of times you want to send the ping request to a particular host. You can choose a custom number between 1 and 99999999999 or unlimited."

"Specify the time interval for each packet to send. In the custom interval you can specify the time in seconds or milliseconds. Ping Tool has 5 predefined profiles:
	-Very Short - 0.2
	-Short - 0.6
	-Normal - 1
	-Long - 2
	-Very Long - 3"
Why do some packets go out of order and scratched?
"An application to run the PING command, which is a network diagnostic tool. To ping you need to put the host (URL or IP address) you want to test and press the PING button."
Why can not I ping IPv6 addresses on Android 9.0?
Unfortunately it is not up to us to solve this problem, in Android 9.0 there is this limitation that does not allow the system to ping IPv6 addresses.
"No, the Ping Tool runs the ping command inside the Android terminal on your mobile phone and gets the results."
"Why can not we have an interval of 0.1 milliseconds?"
"By the rules of Android, only the superuser can set the range with values ​​less than 0.2 millisecond."

"This can happen when your internet is very bad, the reason for getting out of order is not an application bug, but Android bug, Ping Tool scratches these packets just to make it easier to identify. Unfortunately it is not up to us to solve this problem, sorry."
"Why do some packets leave scratched and with the message (DUP!)?"

"This can happen when your internet is very bad. The Ping Tool scratches these packets just for identification, not an application bug. The message (DUP!) Means that the packet has been duplicated or damaged, this is unusual to happen and the reasons are varied."
"If the option is enabled the Ping Tool will only show the ping responses. Statistics at the end of the ping will not be shown."
"What is the message \"Doze Mode enabled, ping stopped.\"?"

"Doze Mode is an Android battery-saving system that optimizes apps that are in the background to save battery power. With this when you are pinging and leave the cell with the screen off for a while the Ping Tool loses access to the internet because Doze Mode blocks access. If you want Ping Tool to continue pinging even with the screen off, you will have to disable Doze Mode on your phone just for the Ping Tool. Doze Mode is present in Android 6.0 or higher."
"Ping will be stopped, are you sure you want to continue?"
"The settings will be reset to the default, do you want to continue?"

Specify whether you want to ping a host using only IPV4 or using IPV4/IPV6. If you are using IPV4/IPV6 mode and your connection supports IPV6, the Ping Tool will give preference to IPV6. If IPV4/IPV6 is disabled, then your Android version does not support pinging IPv6 addresses. See more information in the help menu.
"Your connection does not support IPV4, change the mode to IPV4/IPV6 in the settings."
"Your connection does not support IPV4, so there is no way to ping an IPv4 host."
"Your connection does not support IPV6, so there is no way to ping an IPv6 host."
"What does the \"Lost packets have been recounted\" warning mean?"
"It means that during ping some packets went out of order and scratched and the Ping Tool recounted the total of packets lost during ping."
"Warning: When the \"only replies\" option is checked, Ping Tool will not count the packets that were lost last, as soon as ping stops the packet count will stop together."
"Specifies the number of data bytes to be sent. The default is 56, which translates into 64 ICMP data bytes when combined with the 8 bytes of ICMP header data."
Couldn\'t find an email app and account
Your connection does not support IPV4 and your version of Android do not supports ping on IPV6 connection!
Give the overlay permission to continue.
"You can not start the float window if the option \"only replies\" is disabled."
With this option enabled, you can ping a floating window by overlaying other applications. Lost packets are displayed every time there is a loss of packet in the floating window.
This changes the size of the text in the floating window, the larger the text, the larger the window.
Please write in detail what is the problem
